meanings.sent1: The hardass at work never let anyone take advantage of him.
meanings.sent2: My grandpa was known as a hardass during his time in the military.
meanings.sent3: The hardass coach made the team run laps even in the pouring rain.
meanings.sent4: She was a hardass when it came to negotiating contracts, never backing down.
meanings.sent5: The hardass bouncer at the club never let anyone in without checking IDs.

meanings.definition: Someone who is strict or demanding in their expectations or behavior
meanings.sent1: The teacher was a hardass about turning in assignments on time.
meanings.sent2: My boss can be a real hardass when it comes to following company policies.
meanings.sent3: The hardass librarian shushed anyone who made even the slightest noise.
meanings.sent4: Her father was a hardass, always expecting perfection from his children.
meanings.sent5: The hardass judge gave the defendant a stern warning before sentencing.
